Key Match Events: James Harden bounced back from a rough shooting first half to scatter 14 points in the third quarter.
The Clippers took a 74-72 lead before the fourth quarter.
Harden added eight more points to his tally, four coming in the final 1:14 in regulation.
Harden had a chance to win the game for the Clippers but missed a potential game-winning layup as time expired.
The Phoenix Suns walked away with a 116-113 win in overtime.
Pre-Game Insights: Without Kawhi Leonard, “The Beard” led the Clippers against the star-studded visitors.
Clippers coach Ty Lue forced Suns defenders to go through multiple screens to give “The Beard” some daylight.
Post-Match Reflections: Harden looked tired in the extra period. He continued to run the offense but couldn't complete his heroics as the Phoenix Suns walked away with a 116-113 win in overtime.
Harden impressed on offense, smartly using screens and switches to get his preferred matchups.
Harden also showed up on the defensive end. He hustled and provided help defense when needed.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers hosted the Phoenix Suns at the newly-opened Intuit Dome.
Devin Booker played a key role in limiting the three-time scoring champ James Harden.
The Clippers needed vintage James Harden to compete against Phoenix Suns
